description:
Join us once again for the next PyData Bristol Meetup! 🎉🐍
The PyData community in Bristol continues to thrive with engaging talks, insightful lightning sessions, and lively networking. A massive thank you to our generous hosts, [Cookpad](https://cookpad.com/uk/home), for supplying the venue, [Adlib](https://www.adlib-recruitment.co.uk/) for the scrumptious pizza 🍕, and thirst-quenching refreshments 🍺🧃🥤, along with additional sponsorship.

Agenda for the evening:
🚪 6:00 pm - Doors open
🕡 6:30 pm - Talks commence (sharp!)

📚 Two 25-minute talks:

* Talk 1: "A Random Walk Down GPT Street" by David Greenwood
* Talk 2: "Mastering Machine Learning Techniques for Time-Series Analysis" by Ben Auffarth

⚡️ Two 5-minute lightning talks:

* Lightning Talk 1: Prices are Risky Business by Alistair Rogers
* Lightning Talk 2: TBC by speaker

📢 Community announcements
🤝 Relaxed networking over beers and soft drinks

Interested in sharing your knowledge or experience at this or a future event? Fill out this form to submit your talk proposal: [https://goo.gl/forms/8lsz1WA1986Ahbbs1](https://goo.gl/forms/8lsz1WA1986Ahbbs1)
We look forward to seeing you there for another fantastic evening of Python, Data Science, and camaraderie!

**TALKS**
===

**1\. A Random Walk Down GPT Street**
===

By the time you've finished reading this abstract, this talk will already be out of date. This is a light-hearted exploration of the ever-accelerating LLM landscape. It seeks to understand what's happening in the space, the various open-source projects available and how you might be able to use it at work or in your life as a practical data scientist or analyst. And if you're feeling really brave how-to run your own GPT from the comfort of your laptop.

# **2.** Mastering Machine Learning Techniques for Time-Series Analysis

Dive into the vast and ever-evolving Python time-series ecosystem with this comprehensive talk designed to help you navigate and harness the power of cutting-edge libraries and models for time-series analysis. Ben Auffarth, a renowned expert and author, will guide you through this engaging and insightful journey.

Beginning with an overview of essential time-series concepts, the talk will transition into a deep dive into training statistical time-series models and modern machine learning techniques. You'll gain hands-on experience with deep learning, gradient boosting models, and other advanced machine learning approaches, becoming confident in their practical application.

Throughout the talk, Ben will share valuable tips and best practices to ensure you're well-equipped to tackle real-world time-series challenges. By the end, you'll feel empowered to effectively analyze and apply machine learning methods to time-series data, unlocking new possibilities and insights in your work.

**LIGHTNING TALKS**
===

**3\. Prices are Risky Business \(ML in Insurance Pricing\)**
===

Have you ever received a series of insurance quotes and thought.. how did they get that price? There's more and more machine learning involved in that decision

Alistair Rogers is a Data Science Manager at LV= General Insurance (owned by Allianz) and co-organiser of PyData Bristol. He has over 6 years of experience delivering Machine Learning and Analytics solutions within Financial Services and Insurance (as well as Healthcare and Government!)

# **4\. TBC**

...

🕖 **LOGISTICS**
Talks kick off at **18:30** sharp; then networking/beers in The Knights Templar from **20:40.**
**If you realise you can't make it**, please un-RSVP in good time to free up your place for your fellow community members.
Follow @pydatabristol (https://twitter.com/pydatabristol) for updates on this and future events, as well as news from the global PyData community.

📜 **CODE OF CONDUCT**
The PyData Code of Conduct governs this meetup (https://pydata.org/code-of-conduct/). To discuss any issues or concerns relating to the code of conduct or behaviour of anyone at the PyData meetup, please contact the PyData Bristol organisers, or you can submit a report of any potential Code of Conduct violation directly to NumFOCUS (https://numfocus.typeform.com/to/ynjGdT).
title: PyData Bristol - 22nd Meetup
